sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: At least 22 people have been killed in a Russian missile strike on a railway station in eastern Ukraine.

sentences.sentence: The attack came as the country marked 31 years of independence from the Soviet Union.

sentences.sentence: French President Emmanuel Macron heads to Algeria to mend ties amid Europe's looming energy crisis.

sentences.sentence: Fears of Russian attacks during Ukraine's Independence Day were realized on Wednesday as bombs rained down in the country's southeast.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: At least 25 civilians were killed, with up to 31 injured following missile strikes on a train station and residential area in Chapliny.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The town, located east of the regional capital of Dnipro, is on the front line of Moscow's invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: In its daily briefing, Russia's military spokesperson claims the attack targeted a military train carrying up to 200 Ukrainian servicemen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: There was no mention of the residential area that was also supposedly struck or the civilians killed, two of which were children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The attack has received widespread international condemnation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: In a tweet, the EU's chief diplomat, Joseph Boré, said those responsible will be held accountable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The UN, meanwhile, called on Russia to stop its war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Six months on, the fighting continues amid almost unthinkable risks posed to civilians and the environment as hostilities are conducted close to the Saporizhia nuclear power plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04

sentences.sentence: This fertilizer plant is the biggest in the Baltic states,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: and it's Lithuania's largest single importer of natural gas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But in September, it will temporarily suspend its operations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It's another victim of record high gas prices, which are a key input in the production process.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Last year we paid about 60 euro per megawatt hour, which at the time was a record price.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The price of gas is currently 280 euro per megawatt hour. The price has gone up four times. And fertilizer has doubled in price because it comes from other countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The company which owns the plant employs 1,250 people. Five percent of the workforce will be axed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And the plant may shut down completely if gas prices stay at sky-high levels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: It's a similar story with other European fertilizer producers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: As the industry struggles, supplies are increasingly being sought from other nations, such as the USA, Egypt and Turkey.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The French president is starting a three-day official visit to Algeria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Around 90 other people are going with Emmanuel Macron, including seven government ministers, senior business figures and a boxing champion of Algerian origin. The visit, which will take place in Algiers and Iran, is focused on youth and the future.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But when questioned on the streets, young people interviewed expected little to change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: ALJIERS, We welcome him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: If he wants, he can come to Algiers and live here, and I will go to Europe in his place, because Algiers has nothing to offer. is no work there is nothing every time we go to apply for a job they send us home we want to ask Macron to find us a solution that allows us to leave Algeria we don't expect much from Emmanuel Macron's visit frankly nothing will change in any way in the relations between France and Algeria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Nothing will change in any case.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: That's because of the government, the people, the population and society.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This is Macron's second visit to Algeria as president.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: His first was in 2017.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Relations between the two countries looked promising then, at the time with a young French president born after the Algerian war. But the relationship, marked by the painful shared history of the War of Independence in the 1960s, suffered a blow a year ago, with criticism from the French president that caused a diplomatic crisis. Some today believe that this weekend's visit will only serve the interests of France, since Algeria could become essential for its gas, as Europe seeks to reduce its dependence on Russian energy. The leader of the nationalist Sweden Democrats, Jimmy Åkesson, is in good spirits.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The latest poll results before Sweden's parliamentary election in September show he has partially succeeded in shedding his party's neo-Nazi image.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Sweden Democrats are now the strongest challenges to the incumbent Social Democrats.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And this is all because of one big issue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Security, fighting crime, these are the most important issues for the voters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: I notice that all the time when I talk to people all over the country, criminal gangs, burglar networks from abroad roaming Sweden, stealing things from houses or boats. That's the most important thing we have to deal with now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Sweden has a problem with violent gangs. Almost every week there is a shooting, as here in this shopping centre in Malmö. It's forced the left to also act. The incumbent Social Democrats have announced tougher penalties against gangs. But this shift to the right, rather than taking the sting out of the Sweden Democrats message, is further invigorating them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We want things to get better. That's why we welcome other parties adopting our policies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: But for us Sweden Democrats, it is important to make sure that they keep their promises. We want to be a kind of watchdog that makes sure they actually stick to their word." While Åkesson has long been considered too taboo a coalition partner, other right-wing opposition parties may now work with him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In what's looking like a very tight race between the incumbent centre left block and opposition centre right parties, this willingness may prove a decisive factor.
